chapters.title: Relationship
chapters.text: The relationship between Supply & Demand is ultimately what determines the price of any given good or commodity that you buy.

chapters.title: Definition
chapters.text: Demand is the number of people that are willing to buy a good or a service. Supply is the willingness to produce and sell a certain quantity of the good.

chapters.title: Relevane
chapters.text: Supply & Demand is the most important model used in Economics. At their core, Supply & Demand graphs convey: 1. How much of a good/service producers are willing to SUPPLY at any given price 2. How much of a good/service consumers DEMAND at any given price

chapters.title: Examples
chapters.text:
Tatiana produces and sells orange juice. If she decides to sell her orange juice at $4, then 1,000 consumers will be willing to buy the juice and she will make a profit of $100. If she raises the price to $5, then only 600 consumers will be willing to buy the juice and she will make a profit of $60. If she lowers the price to $3, then 1,400 consumers will be willing to buy the juice and she will make a profit of $140.

Tatiana will choose to produce where she makes the most profit. Thus, Tatiana will price her juice at $3 and produce 1,400 cartons of orange juice.
